description: Coined by Pierre Curie and Marie Curie in 1898 as French radio-actif, equivalent to English radio- +â€Ž active.

adjectives.description: radioactive (comparative more radioactive, superlative most radioactive)

entries.meaning: (figurative, rare) Dangerous and disgusting, particularly of people or ideas.
examples: Even sleazy tactics and his radioactive mouth may not be able to contain this debacle.
Any ship nearby will receive a lethal dose of gamma rays, neutrons, and other radioactives.
